0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Ataluren has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for use in the European Union (EU)
  • Duchenne muscular dystrophy, Associated with nonsense mutation of dystrophin gene: administer ORALLY in 3 divided doses each day: 10 mg/kg in the morning, 10 mg/kg 6 hours later, and 20 mg/kg in the evening 12 hours after the morning dose for a total dose of 40 mg/kg/day (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Ataluren has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for use in the European Union (EU) in pediatric patients 5 years or older
  • safety and efficacy in patients 6 months to 5 years not established
  • Duchenne muscular dystrophy, Associated with nonsense mutation of dystrophin gene: 5 years or older, administer ORALLY in 3 divided doses each day: 10 mg/kg in the morning, 10 mg/kg 6 hours later, and 20 mg/kg in the evening 12 hours after the morning dose for a total dose of 40 mg/kg/day (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Duchenne muscular dystrophy, Associated with nonsense mutation of dystrophin gene

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to ataluren or any of its ingredients
  • concomitant use of IV aminoglycosides

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • -- hypertension with coadministration of systemic corticosteroids has been reported; monitoring recommended
  • Endocrine and Metabolic:
  • -- increased triglycerides and cholesterol have been reported; monitoring recommended
  • Hepatic:
  • -- close monitoring recommended for patients with hepatic impairment
  • Musculoskeletal:
  • -- lack of nonsense mutation in the dystrophin gene; use not recommended
  • Renal:
  • -- close monitoring recommended for patients with renal impairment
  • -- small increases in serum creatinine, blood urea nitrogen, and cystatin C have been reported; monitoring recommended
  • Concomitant use:
  • --avoid use with other nephrotoxic drugs; if treatment is necessary (eg, vancomycin to treat MRSA), renal monitoring is recommended

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Endocrine metabolic:Decrease in appetite (1% to less than 10%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Nausea (greater than or equal to 10%), Vomiting (greater than or equal to 10%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (greater than or equal to 10%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Nonsense mutations in the dystrophin gene create premature stop codons that prevent full protein translation resulting in the disease Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Ataluren allows a full ribosomal readthrough of the mRNA such that a full-length protein is encoded. However, the activity is based on continuous exposure to ataluren.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Tmax, Oral: 1.5 hours
  • Bioavailability, Oral: 55% or greater after initial dose; declines by 40% at steady state

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Liver: primarily via uridine diphosphate glucuronosyltransferase (UGT1A9)
  • Intestine: primarily via uridine diphosphate glucuronosyltransferase (UGT1A9)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
General Information
  • mix full contents of sachet into at least 30 mL of liquid or 3 tablespoons of semisolid food (eg, yogurt or applesauce) and mix well
  • amount of liquid or semisolid food may be increased
  • administer immediately once mixed with liquid or semisolid food and give the entire dose
  • dispose of unused portion according to local regulations
  • missed dose, if less than 3 hours after morning or midday dose or less than 6 hours after evening dose: administer missed dose with no changes; if more than 3 hours after morning or midday dose or more than 6 hours after evening dose: skip missed dose and administer next scheduled dose

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• improvements in muscle function and ambulation may indicate efficacy.
  • hepatic or renal function; during use in patients with hepatic or renal impairment
  • lipid panel; annually or as clinically indicated
  • serum creatinine, BUN, and cystatin C levels; every 6 to 12 months or as clinically indicated
  • blood pressure; every 6 months or as clinically indicated in patients on concurrent steroid therapy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient to avoid activities requiring mental alertness or coordination until drug effects are realized as drug may cause dizziness.
  • Side effects may include headache, nausea, vomiting, decreased appetite, constipation, diarrhea, abdominal pain, epistaxis, erythema, enuresis, pyrexia, or fatigue.
  • Tell patient to maintain adequate hydration.
  • Instruct patient to take a missed dose as soon as possible if the delay is less than 3 hours after the scheduled morning or midday dose or less than 6 hours after the evening dose. If the delay is more than 3 hours after the morning or midday dose or more than 6 hours after the evening dose, skip the missed dose.
